name: JavaScript Fundamentals
description: Test your knowledge of JavaScript basics

questions.content: What is the output of: typeof []
questions.explanation: Arrays in JavaScript are objects. Use Array.isArray() to check for arrays.

questions.content: Which of the following are falsy values in JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Falsy values: false, 0, '', null, undefined, NaN. Empty arrays [] are truthy!

questions.content:
Complete the arrow function:

const add = (a, b) _____ a + b;
questions.explanation: Arrow functions use => for implicit returns without braces.

choices.text: Prevents silent errors and disables some features

questions.explanation: Strict mode catches common mistakes and prevents unsafe actions.

questions.content:
To check if a variable is an array, use:

Array._____(myVar)
questions.explanation: Array.isArray() returns true if the argument is an array.

questions.content:
What will this code output?

console.log(1 + '2' + 3);
questions.explanation: JavaScript coerces 1 to '1', concatenates with '2' to get '12', then concatenates with 3 to get '123'.

questions.content: Which methods modify the original array?
questions.explanation: push() and splice() modify the original array. map() and filter() return new arrays.

questions.content:
To prevent object properties from being modified, use:

Object._____(myObj)
questions.explanation: Object.freeze() prevents adding, removing, or modifying properties on an object.
